did.unittitle:
Mark Wayland Tenny visual materials
1895 and 1897
did.abstract: Holly, Michigan resident. Sketchbook of Jacksonville, Florida views, including buildings and ships; watercolor of the University of Michigan Library; and a drawing of the library clock tower at the University of Michigan.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Mary and Emery George (donor no. 6798).

accruals.p: Periodic additions to the records are not expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Mark Wayland Tenny visual materials, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Mark Wayland Tenny was an civil engineering graduate of the University of Michigan, class of 1895. As a hobby, he painted and drew the sights he saw on his travels.

scopecontent.p: The Tenny collection consists of one sketchbook containing depictions of the buildings, houses, and ships harbored at Jacksonville, Florida. There are also two drawings of University of Michigan views, the library and the clock tower of the library.
